{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:11:00.819
    | text      = The USSR didn't join because they were a totalitarian government and were not invited.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:11:21.460

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:11:32.819

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:00.180

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:01.539
    | text      = Generally speaking, either you try and get away with it while involved,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:09.060
    | text      = And then you start some shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:11.380
    | text      = Frustrated by the US Congress blocking the League of Nations,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:14.979
    | text      = British intelligence, with the help of the Rockefeller family,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:18.260
    | text      = set up the Council on Foreign Relations in New York City in 1921.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:23.619
    | text      = The Council recruited the best and brightest of American life
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:26.899
    | text      = to support the growth of the Anglo-American empire.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:31.619
    | text      = The CFR's stated mission is to abolish all nation-states
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:35.380
    | text      = in favor of an all-powerful world government.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:38.340
    | text      = Where did they state that?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:39.460
    | text      = They didn't.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:40.340
    | text      = Their stated purpose is very different.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:40.899
    | text      = It seems like a weird stated mission.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:43.060
    | text      = Is that like front page of their website?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:45.060
    | text      = No, actually their stated purpose on their website is very clear.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:48.260
    | text      = The Council on Foreign Relations is an independent, non-partisan
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:51.300
    | text      = membership organization, think tank, and publisher dedicated to being a resource for its members,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:55.699
    | text      = government officials, business executives, journalists, educators, students,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:12:59.380
    | text      = civic and religious leaders, and other interested citizens in order to help them
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:02.500
    | text      = better understand the world and the foreign policy choices
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:05.460
    | text      = facing the United States and other countries.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:07.140
    | text      = Right, but what about the fine print?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:08.420
    | text      = Founded in 1921, CFR takes no institutional positions on matters of policy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:14.260
    | text      = CFR carries out its mission by maintaining a diverse membership,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:17.140
    | text      = including special programs to promote interest and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:19.699
    | text      = develop expertise into the next generation of foreign policy leaders.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:23.539
    | text      = They go on to explain that after the difficult negotiations of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:28.180
    | text      = a group of diplomats, financiers, generals, and lawyers concluded that Americans needed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:32.899
    | text      = to be better prepared for significant responsibilities and decisions in world affairs
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:37.939
    | text      = and sought to be that educational voice.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:40.340
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:41.779
    | text      = So there's also, I'm not going to read this whole thing because it's super long.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:44.579
    | text      = So where did they say, no more governments, one world government?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:48.979
    | text      = They don't say that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:49.699
    | text      = No fine print?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:50.579
    | text      = Because I've signed a lease before, and it turns out that they were telling me that there
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:54.739
    | text      = were no governments.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:55.779
    | text      = So I just want to be sure that there's no fine print on this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:13:58.420
    | text      = Well, one of the things that really scares Luddy's conspiracy weirdos like Alex about
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:02.659
    | text      = this, like destroying borders and uniting one world government, is they often cite this
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:08.340
    | text      = 2006 op-ed posted on the CFR's own website, written by the president of the council himself,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:14.180
    | text      = Richard Haass.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:15.380
    | text      = The basic argument is as follows.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:17.619
    | text      = The world's 190 plus states now coexist with a larger number of powerful non-sovereign,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:23.300
    | text      = and at least partly and often largely independent actors, ranging from corporations to non-governmental
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:29.300
    | text      = organizations, from terrorist groups to drug cartels, from regional and global institutions
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:33.859
    | text      = to banks and private equity funds.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:36.100
    | text      = The sovereign state is influenced by them for better and for worse, as much as it is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:40.899
    | text      = able to influence them itself.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:42.899
    | text      = The near monopoly of power once enjoyed by sovereign states is bound to be the one that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:47.140
    | text      = states is being eroded, not by some sort of evil nefarious plan, but just by the rising
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:53.619
    | text      = power of...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:54.619
    | text      = International corporations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:55.619
    | text      = Well, in as much as we're able to communicate better, there's a freer flow of literally
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:01.300
    | text      = everything across the entire world, and it takes away from the power of states to be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:06.579
    | text      = able to...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:07.579
    | text      = Which is why countries like China and Russia and North Korea struggle so hard to keep the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:14.020
    | text      = outside internet from being in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:15.779
    | text      = Totally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:16.779
    | text      = And you start to see around the world at what other people are doing, you're like, wait,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:20.819
    | text      = why are we...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:21.819
    | text      = Or if you let your people go overseas and experience it themselves, like what happened
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:26.020
    | text      = with every low-princeep going to Sarajevo.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:29.180
    | text      = So he goes on, he talks a bit about this idea of needing to redefine what a lot of our national
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:34.100
    | text      = ideas are.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:35.380
    | text      = And this is a quote from his op-ed, our notion of sovereignty must therefore be conditional,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:39.859
    | text      = even contractual rather than obsolete.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:41.819
    | text      = If a state fails to live up to its side of the bargain by sponsoring terrorism, either
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:45.859
    | text      = transferring or using weapons of mass destruction, or conducting genocide, then it forfeits the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:50.539
    | text      = normal benefits of sovereignty and opens itself up to attack, removal, or occupation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:54.779
    | text      = The diplomatic challenge for this era is to gain widespread support for principles of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:59.100
    | text      = state conduct and a procedure for determining remedies when these principles are violated.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:04.640
    | text      = The goal should be to redefine sovereignty for an era of globalization, to find a balance
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:09.159
    | text      = between a world of fully sovereign states and an international system of either world
}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:46:34.500

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
